metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4382 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: A use-after-free flaw caused by a race among the superblock operations in the gadgetfs Linux driver was found. It could be triggered by yanking out a device that is running the gadgetfs side. Gerald Lee discovered that the USB Gadget file system implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: sbeattie> Because the USB gadget interface is for when the system is acting as a USB device rather than a host, the USB Gadget FS is not mounted by default in Ubuntu.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
